name: Valerie Dale
text: Very nice facility providing that very much needed care in the Dothan Alabama area. we had to visit a friend in the intensive Care unit and the male nurses there were overlooking this gentleman were of exceptional character and worthy to be acknowledged for their friendliness and overall pleasant personalities. If the rest of the staff is anywhere like these men, I believe your loved ones would be well taken care of. May the Father bless all of you.

name: Revonda Nordman
text: Having stayed at this hospital a few nights with my aunt that had suffered a stroke I wouldn't recommend this hospital. The nursing staff is horrible! Housekeeping may be understaffed so to explain the reason for the dirty linens, dirty floors and overflowing trash cans. Would not myself be admitted to this hospital.

name: Annette Ezell
text: I have been to the emergency alot,due to heart disease.Severe heart disease and other things.My cardiologist was excellent,however,I couldn't really go to a drs.private office with severe chest pain.Dr.Pic,in the e.r.diagnosed me with his expertise in heart attack cases,by listening to the absence of what should have been...luckily he admitted me.A morning heart cath showed two arteries 95%occluded.I had open heart,bypass,a week later.Surgeon,Dr.Johnson performed the successful surgery.I have found sincere,compassionate physicians at Southeast amc...My life has literally been saved several times,after three heart attacks.Dr.Mcdonald has always shown concern for me,along with Dr.Davis,Dr.Jonas,etc.Thank you for being so kind and great at what you do!

name: M Jones
text: Was here January 2020 and now in February 2021. There's  a difference in staffing. COVID policy restricts to 1 visitor per day. ER let 1 family member go with patient. All visitors out at 6PM, no overnight. Caregivers try, but are sometimes overwhelmed.  Lots of nursing students under supervision.

name: Jackie Jones
text: The ER staff is rude, inconsiderate, and lack compassion. Kinda like people being sick is inconvenient for them...

name: Dobriyin Harris
text: I have tried to find appreciation for this hospital over the years. However, recently my mother was admitted for a common surgery and somehow ended up having a stroke. At one point during her stay she was given too much medication. There is absolutely no well thought out Covid policies for admitted patients and family members. No one was allowed to see her at any point moreover no one called to update any family member on her status. In short, go to flowers.

name: A B
text: I was seen in triage from a car accident where I was the passenger. The driver's car insurance paid all the bills back in February from a January accident. Since then I've been fighting to get SEMC to realize the checks were sent and it is a closed account. Now I receive a letter today that SEMC sent me to collections. It is a nightmare dealing with their finance department. Next time I visit a hospital I hope I am dead. Beware to anyone who ever has to deal with SEMC because they will screw everything up and I would never trust them to treat me after this experience.

name: Cheryl Christian
text: Guarded and safe

name: Sherrie Stallings
text:
I ended up needing hip surgery so that was a bummer. My care team was the ABSOLUTE BEST I have ever experienced in my life! I'm a retired Oncology Nurse as well, so I KNOW excellence.  From the girls at the registration desk, to Ronald who took me back,  to Brent who was my first nurse to Erin who was AMAZING to an old lady with spunk, lol. Then I had Anne at the end who was a spectacular end to a very unexpected day. From the cleaning folks who do an exceptional job to the other staff who weren't "mine" for my stay. I cannot express the genuine faith and level of comfort I experienced!!!! These people at the Same Day Surgery deserve an award....seriously!!! If I were still able to work I would do everything in my power to grab everyone of them at any cost. Why? Because in a global pandemic...in a hospital present day....TRUE FAITH AND COMFORT ARE DANG NEAR IMPOSSIBLE TO ACHIEVE!!!
MY TEAM DID JUST THAT!!! BRAVO!!!!

name: Jim Dunham
text: We are from the Montgomery area and expected there to be a long line to see Dr. Shah. We were shocked when he could see us in less than a week! There were mere minutes of wait time once we were checked in (which went very fast as well). Dr. Shah impressed us with his knowledge and ability to pinpoint the issues my wife was having with her feet. I was most excited to hear him say that he WILL fix her to a point where she's without pain which is something she's been dealing with for almost a year. We are both excited to start this journey to her well-being!

name: Shelly Peed
text: Time wasted seeing a nurse practitioner when she was just a go between for me and the Doctor I was supposed to be seeing. Now I have to go  back to see the the real Doc. I guess my time isn't valuable.

name: Mike Thompson
text: Dr. Kafchinski was very easy to speak with and explained in great detail my diagnosis. Felt as she was not rushing in/out on to the next. She took the time to explain and answer every question I had, which made me feel very comfortable. Dr. Kafchinski and the Staff were Great to work with.

name: Teresa Cunningham
text: My son and I were very pleased with his appointment with Dr. Kafchinski.  All the staff, techs and doctors were very attentive and listened well, then explained options for his treatment.

name: Chuck Jones
text: First person you meet when you walk through the doors are the covid testers.. they greet you with a smile and take your temperature and then moved on to the check-in for the staff was great then sent to x-ray where they were absolutely great Dr Wilson and her nurse assistant May Day that was nervous for me one that I left for the smile even though and I have to get operated on Dr Wilson is down the Earth and will make you laugh I had to get a CT scan and therel I met one of the sweetest person I've ever met.. she was a young lady that had a glow spiritual glow that was just set your heart at ease she had a hallelujah tattoo on her forearm right there I knew I was in good hands I think everything was great about this place except parking

name: Kem Franklin
text:
Dr. K and her entire staff are very friendly.  Dr. K explained everything to us so that we understood.  Even when using extremely confusing medical terms, she took the time to convey it to us so that the information didn't fly over our heads.  Because of the care she exhibited, we decided to make the 1.5 hour drive for her to do my son's surgery when I'm sure our local doctor could have done the surgery as well.

My son immediately liked and trusted her.

name: Rippen Rip
text:
Dr K is a great person.
Her light shines bright.🙂
God bless her.

name: donald jones
text: Ortho group at the UAB hightlands has been ones who have gone beyond the call of duty for me. My Doctor Theiss has seen that I was given back the ability to enjoy my grandchildren once again. Thank you so much.

name: Dacota Fabisinski
text: It was a relief to speak with Dr. Theiss and fellow Dr. Aziz about my symptoms and the surgery I've been considering - they were both kind, patient and answered my questions clearly. Easily the best bedside manner of any medical professional I've seen. I came away from my appointment feeling that I can make an informed decision about my health. Dr. Theiss is wonderful and instilled a lot of confidence that I can improve my quality of life with his professionalism and knowledge - it doesn't have to be confusing and scary.

name: Teresa Burns
text: Great hospital. Clean and well staffed

name: Julie Blankenship
text: Great experience and love Dr. Brabston and his staff!  If you have shoulder issues, give him a call!

name: Dallas Rice
text: It is a great place and the doctors are real nice and the staff is also

name: David Simmons
text: The Orthopedics Team at UAB Highlands is the best, they have taken great care of me while recovering from my motorcycle crash.

name: Anthony Winchester
text: I had a wonderful experience during my visit at Highlands hospital.

name: Kimber D. Washington
text: My experience has brought a profound level of quality that I haven't had in years.

name: Darlene Hays
text: Love Dr. Sherrill and his staff.

name: Meegan Dale
text: Easy to find and easy free parking. Clean facility and kind, friendly staff.

name: Jeri Cole
text: This was my first time in this facility.  The check - in process was very efficient, I waiting minimal time and had an excellent experience.

name: kathy Stanford
text: Excellent care and little time waiting!

name: Juan Gutirrez
text: Needing health assistance it's always bad news but if you have to, this are the best hands you can be on to be taken care of.

name: Rick Gamel
text: Very caring and professional staff.

name: T Kennedy
text:
Speaking on my individual experience:
Seek medical care here only if you don't mind being a part of the herd.

name: C Weber
text: Very nice and takes time to talk to you.

name: Tim Hall
text: Thank you for being personal in a time when health care can be impersonal.

name: Ask for Billions
text: very friendly staff all the way around.

name: Christopher Brainard
text: Choose UAB.  They are high quality.

name: Asha Handley
text: Wonderful practice.

name: Kathy Hofstadter
text: We had a great experience.

name: James Adam
text: So helpful!

name: Es D
text: They do not listen to what you say

name: Marissa Keppley
text: Great experience!!!

name: Sarah Capps
text: Always caring people it’s an ER your gonna have to wait sometimes. But great care

name: John Toelaer
text: Arrive for wife's ruptured ovarian cyst. Give list of meds and allergies to triage nurse - lortab causes vomiting as with most people nowadays. See doctor later, doctor knows nothing about patient hasn't looked at chart. Offers ONLY lortab- doesn't care that she's allergic. They DO NOT have access to Huntsville Hospital's records. If they did, they would see that this happened a year ago. Dilaudid was given during that visit which worked(and is fairly commonplace treatment for such) this doctor refused, claiming that lortab is plenty for this. Never once did they do ultrasound to find cyst, just xray (cyst rarely shows on X-ray. She did get checked for appendicitis though. Everything medical as far as diagnosis goes has been off the cuff. Small town egos and little outside knowledge. Don't bring anyone you love here. I am burdened with telling everyone I know that this is 3rd world medicine over here.

name: Siana Powell
text: sometimes there is a long wait-depending on the ambulances that come in, as it should be. Staff is extremely professional and compassionate, especially when I have migraines.

name: Michael Pilkilton
text: Your okay if you don't get Dr Osbourne .she has no clue what is going on check credentials .

name: Dominique Hudson
text: wow I love this place and i’ve just been here once!!! erin was amazing at her job, and the scheduling lady, alissa was so sweet. I was so nervous when I first came but Erin made me feel right at home.

resp.text: Hello, Dominique. That's great to hear! We're so glad to know that Erin and Alissa put you at ease and made you feel comfortable.  Thank you for taking the time to let others know about your experience at Huntsville Hospital Therapy and Sports Rehab.

name: Mark Toland
text: Had a hip replacement and the therapists are very nice. Understanding and compassionate but fair. They make sure you do what is needed to get better for your own good. But are also aware everyone has a different opinion of what pain is. Some people break a toe and fall apart. Others myself included can break bones and not go to the ER for 2 or 3 days. If you follow directions and dedicate yourself to doing what needs to be done they are awesome! Every person I have interacted with has treated me as a person with respect and understanding-that alone is worth more than you realize. Thank you to everyone there for their support and hard work.

resp.text: Hi, Mr. Toland! We love hearing from our patients and appreciate you taking  the time to share your experiences. We're glad to know that our staff made such a positive difference in your recovery. We'll make sure our entire team sees your nice message.

name: Carolyn Howell
text: Cardiac rehabilitation was very helpful in my recovery!

resp.text: That is wonderful to hear, Ms. Howell!

name: Cyndi Hebert
text: We used to love this place, but the doctor tonight has changed my mind. We were treated rudely and beneath her. She had no care in the world about my child and had her mind made up it was depression and not sickness. FYI, he has a brain disease. Smh. Hello Vanderbilt, goodbye Children's.

name: Mindy Tobin
text: This is not a first come first serve hospital..this is a sickest child goes first hospital..thank god..Remembering that time is of the essence in the event of an emergency while you wait is a must.sometimes the sickest baby doesnt look ill at all..oh and..its christmas time !!

name: pedro martinez
text: We have been to many urgent care facilities over the years, but tonight was another level. We had to go the children's. I can not tell you what it meant to us. From the moment we walked in the door, things were different. This is the kind of medical care I heard my mom talk about in the 50's, genuine concern and compassion. We had been to 2 different urgent cares and had gotten the run around, before we finally decided, we need to go downtown to children's. The urgent care facilities' demeanor was negative and "be thankful for what you get". Children's was different. Compassion and loving urgency to get this child some comfort was so obvious. My child immediately relaxed and become a willing patient. In short, he felt their love. Man, that makes a huge difference! Please don't stop being the compassionate and loving medical providers that you are, it makes oceans of difference.

name: Patty Griffith
text: Children’s of Alabama Emergency Room is a place where they will put your mind at ease. Your child or children are in the best care. I have taken my son more than once and never felt so reassured that he would be taken care of like he was one of their children. You can valet your car to avoid the hassle between 16th and 17th street. A great service to make the emergency room trip run smoothly.

name: Drew Mack
text: I am a patient that has had back issues going on for 4 months without a diagnosis.   I went into the ER because I had no way to stop my pain.  I entered the ER around 8:00pm.   I had a very high BP and pain level.   I got called back about 8:30pm and was admitted into the hospital for 5 days.  Thank you Children’s for all of your help.  I will fight through this.

name: McDonald *
text: Wow, ER doctors are so good now they can diagnose a toddler that has had 3 days of temp (currently 104) just by looking at them. NO testing required!!

name: Jack R
text: Eh, it was decent! it took forever for doctors to come, but not bad at all

name: G G
text: The wait was long but the quality of care was worth it.

name: sothonn harbison
text: Don't waste your time- you won't get seen till hours and hours later. By then I could have had my regular pediatrician see my baby. Go to the ER for these signs they say. Very high fever is just another number. No concerns for the vomiting, rapid breathing, hard to breath, seizures, baby turning purple and temperature keeps rising to alarming levels even after medicine, cold rag and bath. And then to be release with a "virus"? Can they be anymore vague?

name: Buddy Skinner
text: The staff, the valet parking make for a pleasant atmosphere upon our arrival at Children’s of AL. ER. The nurses and doctors were all well trained, professional, and also friendly to our child/us.  They listened to him explain his symptoms. Then everything they were doing to treat his illness and get him stabilized. Very comforting knowing such a wonderful, first class facility is located so close to our home. Birmingham is Blessed to have Children’s of AL hospital.

name: Aris Garcia
text: Wonderful staff, they treated my son like he was the only patient...more than a hospital a 5 starts hotel.

name: Alan Thornton
text: My 4 year old nephew waited 4 hours with a neck injury that was hurting him so bad he was shaking. After the 4 hour wait we asked how much longer it would be and was told another 4-5 hours. Meanwhile a guy gets brought in by police in handcuffs cause he got bit by the k9 in the hand trying to run away comes in an hour after us and he got taken straight back. We ended up taking him to another er the next day and when they xray him he had an out of place vertebrae in his neck . But they take in a criminal first... PEICE OF TRASH HOSPITAL

name: shelia wade
text: They quick and they take good care of  Jaylen Bailey when he arrive.

name: Brent Elrod
text: Great place!  They’ve done a lot to help our child.

name: Cristen Greathouse
text: I was sent to children's to get a ct scan after a doctor's x-ray showed something abnormal. My daughter was run a low fever and her white blood cells count was high and she had chest pain a hard time taking a deep breath. When we arrived everything was quick and easy they even give her  medicine to help with the fever . Then we got put in a room the resident doctor can in to tell us that they wasn't doing a ct scan but another x-ray.  I was a little  Confused but ok at 6:30 they took her back for another x-ray she got back at 6:35 . Then the waiting game was on we wanted for a hour for them to tell us she was fine and could go home,but if she started running a fever and having a harder time breathing to bring her back . Then I was really confused.. She was running a fever when we came in and they never  Explained why her white blood cell count was up. But she was fine !! So I guess your telling me my 14yr is making up the chest pain shortness of breath and fever..

name: Ashna S.
text: Love love love this place. The staff are amazing, friendly, gentle, and very caring. The wait can be pretty irritating when your baby is hurting but once they get you back in a room it’s a breeze from there. I had originally taken my daughter to St Vincent’s in Pell City because her doctor had told me to take her there. They were no help. Children’s will always save the day. Thanks so much Children’s hospital.

name: Lythea Brown
text: Worse place I have ever been too! I would not recommend coming here and I want even here for me or my cold I was a friend's driver. But the wait was ridiculous and the front nurses were rude and not helpful and withheld information.

name: Aida Talley
text: The building is beautiful. I did not like the fact that there was a metal detector in a children's hospital. The staff was very nice but we waited for an hour for my daughter to get a room after coming in ambulance then when she was placed in a room we waited two hours and no one every came. One RN said she didn't know we were even in the room. My daughter fainted without warning at a subway while coming from our family vac. She was unconscious shortly but conscious when I arrived. We left the hospital.

name: craig wooden
text: Top notch staff and physicians. Brought my daughter to the ER and had no wait. We went straight to a room and a doctor was in within a few minutes. Everyone was nice and helpful. I would highly recommend Childrens of Alabama.

name: Gus E
text: Our son was transferred here from another hospital bc they couldn’t keep an IV in.  1st try at Children’s, and they get the IV started. Outstanding team.  kudos to all the staff! Very loving and sincere. Simply the best.

name: Kunqi “No longer well rested”
text: Ok i guess. Its really long and the staffs looks like they don't care about their job anymore. I have crohns disease and most of time every time i go to the hospital, they just.. Look at you with dull eyes. Warning the staffs can immediately make you feel unwelcome

name: Holly Fitz
text: 1st time visit to Children's ER around 5pm for high fever and eye swelling following surgery that same morning at 7am. Let me stress to you the shock at walking into this place. When you arrive you hand over your bags to security to be searched and walk through a medical detector. Upon walking in i appalled. The place was disgusting. The floors and chairs were smeared in god knows what and their wasn't a hand sanitizer station visible in the place.  Upon intake my child was given a large dose of Tylenol (even though i had just given him some 2 hours before) the dose was 3.75 ml even though our sheet from pediatrician says weight gets 2.5ml. and he was given a dose of Benadryl and we were sent back to waiting room. After an hour or so we were taken to a room where the billing representative came immediately to collect my 100 copay and then an hour later we saw a resident who snottily corrected me when i called him a nurse. He asked some questions looked him over and left. I didn't see anyone again for hours. I was by myself, my child is an infant and i needed to use the bathroom. the only one was in the hall. The bed had no rails to leave my baby in, there was no nurse visible or that answered the call button to assist and the bathroom had no table to lay him on so i could use the bathroom. After a few hours the doctor comes in with a nurse and informs me that my child is allergic to tape (where they taped his eyes down for surgery that morning) and he has sensitive skin. And that they were going to give him a dose of Benadryl to help the swelling. I said NO you just gave him Benadryl on intake and a very large dose of Tylenol. They were like oh we did? Sorry.. I pointed out that the Benadryl did not help and his eye is looking progressively worse and that if he was allergic to tape wouldn't both eyes be like this?  They informed me they weren't going to do anything or run any tests and to follow-up with regular doctor tomorrow. They would however do a flu test to appease me. I know he doesn't have the flu and after 30 minutes i paged the nurse to ask if we can go home and have the flu results called to doctor the next morning? They said they will tell the nurse and send her in to talk to us. Never showed up. Flash forward another hour and 45 minutes. Flu negative and we can finally go home. Vitals and temp never checked since intake and no bloodwork drawn. Nothing. The next morning my child breaks out in the roseola rash. Thanks for nothing Children's. I'm glad my child wasn't having post-surgery infection. If my baby needs to go back to ER. We'll be going to Grandview.

name: HairByTammy T
text: Top-notch facility & staff! Courteous & very thorough! We appreciate the care my son received tonight!

name: Jennifer Hutchings
text: Just want to let you all know that ur emergency staff last night was horrible...i brought my daughter in cause she hit the door frame and had 2 goose eggs on her head and immediately started throwing up. We also brought it to their attention that she was hurting in her private area. They had us there for 2 hrs and didnt do anything but give her some Motrin. When they said that they weren't going to do a ct scan due to radiation we thought ok well we will be going home in a minute then. They kept us there for 2 hrs with them seeing that she was in pain in her private area and they wouldnt do anything but tell us to get some diaper rash cream. They could have given her something for some relief and was going to keep us for 2 more hrs to watch her for the head condition when it was clear that she was fine with that.  I also told them that she is a symptomatic hemophilia carrier and they did absolutely nothing for her. I had to finally just say let us go so we can go get her something to help with the pain. I had to google what i needed to get for her and leave there and go by CVS in the middle of the night when they could have given her something there. I haven't had many problems from children's before but last night was the 2nd worst experience I've had there. Their job is to make these kids feel better not ignore the symptoms. I could have given Motrin at the house and avoided the hr s that I spent up there FOR ABSOLUTELY NOTHING

name: Demyla Matthewjr
text: My son years old and he sick throwing up bleeding nose been here since 8 still n the waiting room a 11 really sad

name: Shannon S Crenshaw
text: Typically we have good service.  Today I have been waiting for 2 plus hours waiting to be seen by the doctor.  I was told due to my child being sicker then other patients it would take longer.  Not sure of that logic.  Not happy, Life with insurance in America.

name: Carrie Harden
text: My 10 yr old daughter died after 42 days on ECMO. We were told in front of dozens of witnesses there just wasn't nothing left they could do yet when we get her med rec it shows they "resuscitative measures were deemed medically futile although family did not explicitly withdraw care" then at 12pm her pump was reduced to 1 which wasn't life sustaining and no further vitals or any other records were logged after 12pm but she didn't die until 1:24pm. Also none of her meds were given except sedation! Why lie? If she was beyond saving then why lie to our faces?

name: raven prince
text: This visit wasn't so great since the  nurse forgot to give me a sample cup for my daughter which postponed our time by an hour since we had to wait for her to use the bathroom again. Dr. Childress is Amazing! This is my second encounter with him and he has been very nice to us. I was excited when I saw the free valet service but upon leaving they lost a patients vehicle! She had her ticket and they brought her another persons keys asking if they were hers and what type of vehicle was it. It took exactly 10mins for them to bring my vehicle and they were still trying to figure out where the lady Durango was. I would've loved to give them 5 stars but sadly this visit wasn't that great.

name: Jenna Walden
text: I brought my 3 year old in due to a fall. Once we arrived, she started vomiting and couldn't stay conscious. The staff could care less. I walked out to the nurses station to find someone to help my daughter and I was told my nurse was giving someone an IV they would get her to my room. After waiting 2 hours, a lady walks in the room to register us and I still had not seen the nurse or a dr. At that point I got up and walked out with my child and went to another ER where they saw her promptly and ran test. I will NEVER take any of my kids to children's hospital again. Very poor service and you will never see a real doc just a "nurse practioner" if one ever makes it around to your room.

name: Ryan Jones
text: Best emergency department in the state! The care you get here is top notch.

name: Poe Edgar
text: We are still sitting in the ER waiting  room after 2 and a half hours. We did get called back but only to be turned around because "we had to give your room to someone else". If you come bring a lunch and have a friend or family member  on reserve so you can rotate.  We will probably still be here waiting when you arrive.

name: Aries Gates
text: Date of Service: 11/15/2016 @9:15pm Room 16 in E.R. I have had the worst experience in my Life! My son has been having Migraines for the last 8 years & he is 12 yrs old. When you have a child that suffers from this type of pain it hurts my Heart that Dr.Anna White would come & ask questions. Conversation: Dr. Anna White    Kameron what's hurting on you? Kameron replies my head is hurting really bad & my stomach. Dr. Anna White asked: How long has your head been hurting & Kameron replied off & on since last night but my stomach started today. Dr. Anna White then asked have he had any bowel movements & Kameron replied: he did earlier today & it was normal. Dr.Anna White asked if he has eaten anything today & Kameron advised he ate a couple hours ago. Dr. Anna White asked what did he eat? Kameron told her  he had Mash Potatoes, Pork Chop, & Corn( Let me add it was the smallest portion of food ever) but anyway Dr. Anna White then goes in to say this is a Non-Emergency Visit because if he tolerated a Meal it's not an Emergency! My response: it's an Emergency  to me because my Son never complains unless he is really sick & if he tells me he needs to go to the Dr. I'm going to bring him. Dr. Anna White then goes on to tell me that they are just counseling patients on Non-Emergency visits, I then cut her off in mid sentence & told her you don't have to help him we will leave because I felt she has had a long day & is now taking it out on us because she feels it's not an Emergency. My son has been at this ER dozens of times & we have never been treated this way. I don't want to ever in my Life step back into this ER as long as I'm breathing because I work in Healthcare as well & our Mission is to always make sure the patient is taken care of. Nurse was Great! Check-in Great! Wait was Ok! The Escort to the room was Great with a Smile! The Patient Coordinator was Great! Dr. Anna White is Horrible & I will write & call Patient Advocate to complain.

name: Amber Ramsey
text: Been sitting in the emergency room for almost three hours and we still don't know what's wrong with our daughter. Is the the doctor even here?

name: Stephanie McDaniel
text: Absolute nightmare. Wait was 4 hrs in waiting room, was back in our room another 8 hrs. Absolutely absurd to be an emergency room. And still no answers!

name: Jaber Alnajar
text: Minimum 6 hours that too much

name: Asia Lawson
text: Great and  caring service very loving faculty

name: Erica Melville
text: Horrible service, have been waiting for hours. Was kind of ghetto and overall a bad experience.

name: Courtney Brianna
text: Came here tonight because my 3 week old baby was sick and was told by her pediatrician to go to the ER if any worse.  That’s exactly what we did and we were told by the front desk staff that it would be another 5-6 hour wait IF things didn’t “change.”  We had already waited 3 and a half hours and decided to leave.  This used to be a great hospital but it’s going downhill quick.  I hope someone is capable of building another pediatric hospital in Alabama one day.  It will be a cold day in hell for me to come back.

name: Koko Toles
text: If you need Primary Care and have insurance cooper green is great the doctor's are on point.i love them

name: Jeremiah Johnson
text: The people here are fantastic! I was greeted upon entry and received the most courteous customer service from the hard working members of the pharmacy staff. These are trying times for the healthcare industry as a whole and to be able to receive such anointed care during a pandemic is a breath of fresh air.

name: Tina Jackson
text: Went about right knee pain, doctor telling me the x-ray technician said I have hip pain & nothing wrong with the right knee. How when I have no problem with my hip, it’s my knee. They don’t know what they are doing!

name: Shelaine Pickron
text:
I have a low co-pay sliding scale bases depending on your income.
I'm grateful

name: Lachanda Carter
text: I didn't go to UAB I went to Cooper Green Mercy Hospital and my wait time was superb but when it comes to me seeing a Dr it is ridiculous. I have serious health issues and haven't seen anyone in 3 years. Then I've asked for a Dr due to my health issues but continue to get a Nurse Practitioner which don't know much about my issues are what to prescribe for them.

name: Richard Bruce Hamilton
text: Kind compassionate care.

name: Kenneth Manning
text: Most employees are great people. They are over worked because how many people come in every single day. They need more people in the pharmacy. That take up the most time, plus the have some weird rulesn

name: Sonovia Duncan
text: Cooper Green Mercy Health Services is a vital part of our community.  The doctors, nurses, administrators, receptionists, imaging department, dental department, laboratory, pharmacy, speciality clinics, Urgent Care Unit, and all personnel, work hard to ensure we receive the best medical care available.  I am grateful to each and every individual responsible for keeping this healthcare choice accessible to the public.  Thank you all for your hard work and dedication to our community.

name: Bobby Cardwell
text: This appears to be a updated site and it is absolutely wonderful. I especially like the easy to follow instructions on how to become a patient. I perused the rest of the site and found it both personable and professional and most informative. Good job guys!

name: Stephanie Hudson
text: Have issues with the amount of time until next appointment but I'm sure it can be explained. Other than that the place is questionable of it's cleanliness. The doctors however are kind and work with you especially in various departments such as dermatology. Primary care Dr is awesome. All in all they work to serve the public who are struggling financially.

name: Timothy Statum
text: I have called 3 times last week to refill my gabbapentin after 3 doctor appoiments to see doctor hamby was canceled by them and today I went to get it after I was told it would be ready by Friday   her nurse was so rude to me today  she said they was 30 people ahead of me and that I needed to just leave    I've been out since Friday and I was hurting pretty bad and was told to just leave   this place will just let you die they don't care   I sure hope that nurse is fired

name: Sexy I Am
text: I’ve called Cooper Green 3 times this morning and their business hours state 730am, it’s now 7:38am and they are still closed. It is sad that low income individuals have poor service. Just because one can’t afford  insurance at the time  or have a difficult time in life we are treated as scum. One of the staff members in the pharmacy also has one of the nastiest rudest attitudes I’ve ever seen. She usually sits on the far right once you walk in the pharmacy. I hope she is no longer there. Several people have complained about her

name: Jonnera Renee
text: I just think it would better if you they stayed open 7 hours a week and not just 5. I mean Saturday and Sunday are days too. I mean come  on, they close at 7. I believe hours should be longer. Any incident can happen any day or any hour of the week. I know there are Hospitals downtown and such but I mean some of us go here because we can afford it. The least they can do is change there hours and change the days they are open. I'm just saying, makes more sense to me.

name: Dee Day
text: Everyone here is great.  The staff, the nurses and the dr.s. the facilities were very nice, and clean.

name: Mohammed Alqahtani
text:
You will never ever be in on your scheduled time even if you arrive ahead of time. I had an Appointment at 8:00 a.m. which means that I should be the 1st patient with that assigned doctor and there will not be any other patient ahead of me to take minutes of my time,  but they were not Available even after 9 am. by then,  I had to reschedual again and leave .
Appointments time is a real problem right there. I do not know why; is it because they do not have supervisors or they do not take people time seriously as patients are low income families!!

name: Kelly Stone
text: My doctor is Mr Eaton. He has a head nurse I've been asking for her name and information so I can sue her and possibly Jamal Brown and Dr Eaton. I've personally told the head nurse and Jamal Brown I had surgery for a kidney stone. The drugs they gave me caused me to fail my lab urine at Cooper Green lab one day after surgery. The head nurse wants to play games, accuse me of failing my urine test and saying xanax in my urine.I have the surgery records ready to give Dr Eaton staff. They won't accept them because they ignore me. Mr Brown said he won't look at them because he can't read surgery records. But he's over the clinical nurses. He says Dr Eatons not there, every excuse to obstruct my pain medications. My best option is to sue for my rights to my prescription. I recommend Cooper Green only for dogs.

name: nunya damnbiznezz
text: Yes, they are slow. But, in their defense they are very, VERY busy. What that does not excuse is their attitudes. If you walk in, accept that everything wrong will be considered YOUR fault. Someone jump a curb and hit you? No they didn't. You must have walked out into the street. Get brutally mugged? No. That's obviously the result of a bar fight or domestic violence. Have epileptic seizures? Please. You're obviously on drugs. In fact, everyone that walks through the doors at Cooper Green are on drugs, have alcohol problems, are in abusive relationships, molest their children, rob banks and worship the devil. Every problem you have, you some how brought on yourself. That's why you'll get eye rolls, condescending tones, lack of empathy and even out right cruelty. I'm sorry Cooper Green, but if sick and injured people are too much for you, you shouldn't have gone into medicine. If impoverished sick and injured people are your problem, you should have specialized in elective surgery. These people are dicks and ultimately, they only help you if you pitch a fit and then it's only as little as they can get away with and just to get you to shut up and go away. Busy, Yes. That's perfectly understandable. Constantly uninterested, lacking in empathy, suspicious, cruel...there's no excuse.

name: Stephanie R. Tinney
text:
I am thankful for them at all, I'm glad they are there.. CG saved many lives of my loved ones and they diligently searched with gusto to find what was wrong with.me to help me. My regular doctor .. I can't think of her name but she was like .. The bet experience I've ever had with any doctor.  Mental HealthServices are in decline all over.
10/15 -2/16

name: Cooper Valentine
text: I had been here for less than an hour was already in a room and had spoken with the doctor he had checked my ears eyes nose throat and all that stuff and has reached a prognosis and so far everything has been going swimmingly I don't really understand where all these bad reviews come from the first person I talked to was probably the rudest out of everybody that I spoke with here and that is to say that she was still the nicest that she could have been she was nicer than any of the people at St Vincent's or uab. The doctors nice and was prompt Kurt coming the nurse is nice and quick the only reason that I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because they gave me a prednisone shot in the butt and it hurt

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: I wouldn't let them put a bandaid on me. 🤕

name: Dan Cooper
text: Make sure whatever you need isn't a permanent condition. This place will lose all your records after discarding you like you don't have a life to continue, if you try to get back on your feet and not stay jobless or disabled. If you have no money and no job, this place will see you after a process. But they honestly don't care about your future

name: Kimberly Thomas
text: The process for CGMHS is great if the people would actually follow the rules instead of looking for a hand out. It's not free healthcare but it is an alternative to affordable healthcare for the uninsured. No other facility offers that to the citizens.

name: Sandra Howards T100
text: Although I had read reviews about the hospital I took a chance and went anyway. Im glad I did. it was clean and the staff was so friendly. the visit was not to long at all and i left there satisfied  with my experience

name: Victoria Cook
text: I Appreciate having Cooper Green when I didn't have any insurance. everyone I came in contact with was very nice and professional. From Doctor Karen Reynolds to her nurse, the check-in lady, to the lady  who drew blood. Everyone was nice. I think about going back since my new doctor and I don't seem to get along

name: REBECCA DILL
text:
Say what you may about the treatment at Cooper Green. However , 98% of the professionals I have had the pleasure of meeting, are very versed in what they are doing and saying. I have always been treated with respect and concern. I have been sent to UAB Southside and UAB Highlands for treatment and testing.
Right now with all of the flu cases they have been bombed with, patient as well as staff, the pharmacy is a place you really don't want to be. They are working on getting it flowing again, give them some time. And as for attitudes... Check yourself and think about what their day has been like. Just because you walk in the door with your negative attitude and expect Private Care treatment, don't mean it's going to happen. They will get to you as time allows. They could sit and be a stone face not happy employee, but why when they can find a little good to laugh about in a room with a bunch of sick folks. My appreciation started with Ms. Peggy Watson and blooms out from there...  From labs, x-rays, pharmacy, therapy, cashier, appointment center...Too many to name but I couldn't feel better sitting in that stuffy ole private Dr. Office. Thanks for being there and may each and every one of you have a Blessed Day and a better tomorrow.
Stop and think about it...  You really don't have to go to Cooper Green.... You could go sit in the Private Office of a cram packed Dr., Don't forget to stop by accounting and make payment arrangements on your way out.

name: Monica R. Dawkins, RN
text: Shaun Tolbert the psychiatrist nurse practitioner told me I took too much dope and was on LSD or PCP and that's why I heard voices. Mind you I have given blood and urine to them repeatedly for tests and no drugs were in my system. I have never taken drugs. Then he says I have insight on myself, yeah I do have insight on what you're saying... You are saying I am black and want pain meds. Well, who would go to psych office to be told they are sick if anything a person would want to hear they are well. He was so rude that he got up while I was talking to get prescriptions in another room. He was upset the entire visit and didn't want to hear nothing I was saying. But my tax dollars keeps that place running and pays his sorry ass salary. I called up there every five minutes and will continue to. I want a different doctor.

name: Juanita McWain-Thomas
text: Caring staff. The wait is long but overall, not a bad experience.

name: Augusta Chambers
text: Good place for indigent care or people of lower income or income distress

name: V O
text: $100 fee if not from the city of Birmingham charged up front. In addition, a $25 fee is assessed with no guarantee of being examined by a doctor.

name: princess tiana quinney
text: lets be respectful and know that if u had insurance then u wouldn't have to complain about the staff or wait ..be mindful people

name: Susan Shelton
text: The only reason I give this place a 1 star is because of Dr Malik in GI. He is the best doctor I've ever had. Otherwise, they would be negative stars.   As for the others, they are  ALL worthless.  Most of the staff is arrogant. This place is a joke.

name: John Bertram
text: the first step in getting help at Cooper Green is a nightmare, these people have no medical experience nor do they have any empathy for any one they assume they own the building, i here the words I ain't  and we ain't constantly I thought it was run by the county not a select few that keep calling you a liar to your face and telling you they ain't gunna pay for your medical bills that you accured before you came in there and you need to go back to the people who where treating you and get them to continue to treat you cause we ain't paying for it... doesn't matter of you tell them you bills before you came to them are being taken care of they still keep telling you not to come to them for help you should be at U.A.B. getting them to treat you... then you tell them U.A.B. advised me to come here to get help and they say they not supposed to do that!!!  so then you ask them what are you supposed to do if you can't afford health care this hospital is for people who need medical care and can't afford it else where... they say you not supposed to come here when you are being treated at another hospital... one one side i agree if you are trying to manipulate the system but if you truly need medical help this where you go... I got approved and was given an appointment that day Sept. 7 for oct. 25 at that time i had a catheter in for my bladder... way to far off i excepted it cause i had to... 7 days before the oct. 25 I get a letter saying my appointment  had been canceled so i called she came back and told me Nov. 25... I said ma'am I seriously can't wait that long I have bladder cancer... she says hang on.... she came back and said sir its 11:50 am can you get here by 12:30 get you card and be in med room 1 by 1 pm... i said yes Ma'am ... i got there at 12:27 they argued with me for 45 minutes saying I lied to them and telling me to go back to the hospital i just came out of i was 15 minutes late and they dont care why but once you get back there to the doctors its a whole new world they are good to you and care about your health

name: Stephoanie L Peterson
text: First Im thankful there is somewhere people like me can go without insurance or having a job I been experiencing pain  in both my knees for a while like over 6 months went to urgent care there without even touching me the white doctor can in and just told me I need two knee replacement I think he was saying it because Im a little overweight but how can you tell someone that without touching them ir even examing them. Secondly I scheduled a appointment to see the doctor there keep in mind I can carely walk some days saw the doctor he put me on steroids for two months and ibuprofen still no help after all thatso when I went back to see him I told him nothing is working he scheduled me for rehab how am I going to do rehab I can barely lift my legs went once never went back, so my next appointment can up with Dr so I ask him could he give me something for pain it lime I ask for narcotic he drugged tested me and everything I was so livid but its okaywith all this been said and more Im still having problems with my knees and he want even order me a MRI i know something is wrong the Rhematologist pulled alot of fluid off my knees so what does it take to get adequate help. Furious Black Woman

name: D Huntress
text: your website is horrible. it gives us no information, no FAQ, and is a pain in the butt to work with. Please Change it!

name: Vanessa-Ann “TooDee” Chassion
text: Dr Shirin Banu,,,,,,dismissed me for having too many health issues and referrals....Dr J W Retan......was a very compassionate Dr when he came to Cooper Green Pain Management in 2013; out of retirement. I liked him at my first visit when he was knew to the clinic, we had a great patient doctor relationship....we even conversed about our families! After a year I asked to alter my meds because I 'think' i had built up an immunity AND that's when all the confusion started. He stopped talking, even during an office visit....he would just type in his computer.....I was baffled...WHY? I figured it was for the med changes BUT that's what pain management does; Manage Pain by changing meds as needed........but in the last year he's transformed into a "Mean Robot"........absolutely NO compassion.....he writes words in "His Computer" comments I did NOT say...and I brought it to his attention 'right away'. He treats me with NO respect,does NOT ask any questions,does NOT examine me, it's obvious to me he just does NOT care. He's going on 84 years old and could be entering senile dementia. I understand Doctors,Nurses,Medical Staff get overwhelmed, especially at Cooper Green Mercy.......When you have labs,MRI's,CAT Scans,DEXA SCANS,past surgeries that are non operable and HAVE to be controlled by pain meds.........I know there is a lot of paperwork, especially for Medicaid patients but Doctors take a "OATH".........Dr Retan considers himself "A MAN OF GOD!"........One day every ONE has to answer to Our God and YOU will be standing before him. ****Treat People, Help People, Give people Respect no matter the LIFE they LIVE in....they NEED help. Isn't this the way YOU; Dr. Retan & Dr. Banu would want to be treated? With compassionate Care?

name: Roger T. Graham
text: Hospital

name: Jin Lee
text: It's alright, make sure you also have money for the parking deck...it's not free..

name: Hai2u Official (Slim)
text: Overall people were recently nice. Clean environment as far as registration center.

name: Randy Martin Jr.
text: My experience at coopergreen has been terrific, thanks for a job well done

name: Jamie Lamb
text: There are many serves here, at low or no cost,. Health, mental health, Detox, saboxone program . Primary care Dr. As well , just to name a few. The staff is friendly.

name: Linda Ackiss
text: Very slow and apathetic staff. I have been treated rudely and repeatedly ignored. Dr Kilpatrick retired and I was sent to see Dr Karen Reynolds who is rude, condescending and prejudiced. I'm through using their services. I no longer care to pay to be treated like I'm worthless!

name: Sameer Dharani
text: very rude staff .. behave like we are criminals ..

name: Deborah Mayer
text: I don't recommend .

name: Lanae Reynolds
text: Almost the entire staff is rude except for a lady in the dental clinic. I wouldn't go here even if it was the last place on earth. I would rather die than go here.

name: Ann L
text: They need to get the patients feedback on the doctors from UAB.

name: Danielle Brown
text: There was a man in the er he had a heart attack in the waiting room and the nurses told him to get back up and sit in the chair and went on about their business like nothing even happened

name: Gloria Love
text: You walk in and nobody tells you anything. The receptionist is too busy on the phone on personal call to pay attention to what's going on. Nobody's being called but you can hear extremely loud laughing and talking in the back. What is up with that.

name: Chrismac1981
text: Some of the best care I've had

name: Richard D Crumpton
text: People are rude here.

name: Deborah Clough
text: Other than Pharmacy delays, due to circumstances beyond their control, it's a great place.

name: DLene “Dee” MzDoRightLoyalty
text: My doctor is the bomb dot com........lol

name: apollyan5
text: I waited for 13 hours before being seen. the staff was rude and facility was dirty.

name: Cece Princess
text: They are very slow but they are the only one who ran test on me besides other doctors.the other doctors did nothing for me but talked crazy.

name: Amanda Hulsey
text: Friendly staff and competent doctors. They were so sensitive to my husband's painful condition and got us an appointment quickly and secured imaging appointments quickly. We are thankful for them!

name: Vic Robertson
text: Dr. Brian Scholl performed surgery on my back and did a superb job. I strongly recommend The Spine Center and its staff.
